Sentencas: Development of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC) for operation at intermediate temperatures of 600-800 degrees C with hydrocarbon fuels requires a cathode and anode with high electrocatalytic activity for O-2 reduction and direct oxidation of hydrocarbon fuels, respectively.
Titulo: A review of wet impregnation - An alternative method for the fabrication of high performance and nano-structured electrodes of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Wet impregnation is a well known method in the development of heterogeneous catalysts.
Titulo: A review of wet impregnation - An alternative method for the fabrication of high performance and nano-structured electrodes of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Surprisingly, very few have concentrated on the application of the wet impregnation technique to deposit nano-sized particles into the established electrode structure of the SOFC.
Titulo: A review of wet impregnation - An alternative method for the fabrication of high performance and nano-structured electrodes of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: This paper reviews and discusses the progress in the application of the wet impregnation technique in the development of Ni-free Cu-based composite anodes, doped CeO2-impregnated (La, Sr)MnO3 (LSM) cathodes and Ni anodes, CO(3)Oy(4)-infiltrated cathodes and precious metal-impregnated electrodes.
Titulo: A review of wet impregnation - An alternative method for the fabrication of high performance and nano-structured electrodes of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Enhancement in the electrode microstructure and cell performance is substantial, showing the great potential of the wet impregnation method in the development of high performance and nano-structured electrodes with specific functions.
Titulo: A review of wet impregnation - An alternative method for the fabrication of high performance and nano-structured electrodes of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: However, the long-term stability of the impregnated electrode structure needs to be addressed.
Titulo: A review of wet impregnation - An alternative method for the fabrication of high performance and nano-structured electrodes of solid oxide fuel cells
